Accessibility Choose a profile and configurate your personal settings for the app UI Accessibility preferences Profiles Predefined profiles Active profile Selected profile Switch to predefined profiles Apply this profile Settings Large text The large text setting increases the text size. Choose a fontface Fontface Fontface allows you to choose a font style you prefer. Standard Serif Dyslexic High contrast Increases the contrast and makes the text on bricks easier to read. Additional icons Adds icons to categories and bricks to improve recognizability. Large icons Increases the size of icons. Icon contrast Changes the brick icons to high contrast icons.
Large element spacing The large element spacing increase the space between touchable elements. Starter bricks Shows only starter bricks for ease of learning. Drag\'n\'drop delay Adds delay to the drag\'n\'drop of bricks. Standard The standard settings My Profile My personal settings Argus Visual improvement: High contrast, additional icons Odin Visual improvement: Large text, large icons, large element spacing, high contrast Fenrir Input improvement: Large element spacing, drag\'n\'drop delay Tiro Learning: Starter bricks Created profile You have created a new profile! The changes you make can be found in \'My Profile\' Profile applied Pocket Code will be restarted to apply the changes you made.

Privacy policy Version 2.0, 20 September 2017\n\n
To offer you all collaborative benefits of our services and the associated account, it is necessary to collect certain data from you.\n\n
• To use your account in our systems, and to inform you about necessary changes about your account (e.g., updates/violation of our Use of Terms of Use and Service or of community rules) or our policies, we will store your username and, if provided by you, your E-Mail address. If you’ve connected your account via Google Plus or Facebook, we additionally store an identification key connected to your account on these services. We will not use this data for any other (e.g., marketing) purposes, unless you explicitly allowed us to do so.\n\n
• To avoid misuse of our services (e.g., through user contributed uploads or comments) for illegal purposes, the user generated public data will be stored internally in a database, together with a timestamp and the used IP address.\n\n
• To improve our services (apps and websites) and to do scientific research on ICT and STEM education, we use Google Analytics, Crashlytics and Firebase by Google Inc. to get metadata about the usage (e.g., timestamps, visited pages/screens, used operating system, and information about the network provider). This analysis and the collected data is not linked to your profile and does not contain any personal information.\n\n
• On a voluntary basis, you can give us your country of residence through your account page on the sharing site. This will only be used for statistical and research purposes by us and can be removed at any time in your profile settings.\n\n
• You can withdraw the usage of this data at any time by deleting your account through your profile page on https://share.catrob.at/. After deleting your account you will still be able to use the provided services, but not to collaborate, e.g., through uploading programs, commenting or liking. Also all provided content linked to your account, e.g. uploaded programs, comments, will get deleted.\n\n
• All Services are provided by the non-profit free open source Catrobat project under the umbrella of the International Catrobat Association – Verein zur Förderung freier Software (Graz, Austria).\n\n
• To get in touch with us, please send an E-Mail to contact@catrobat.org or mail us to Catrobat,\n c/o\n Institute of Software Technology,\n Inffeldgasse 16b/II,\n 8010 Graz, Austria.\n\n
In case you are below the age of 16, this policy must be accepted by a legal guardian (usually parents).
It is necessary to agree the Privacy Policy to register or to further use your account. If you do not want that this data gets collected you can delete your existing account via the profile page on our web interface and still use all services of this app that do not need an account.
Terms of Use and Services In order to be allowed to use the apps and other executables offered by the Catrobat project, you must agree to our Terms of Use and Services and strictly follow them when you use our apps and other executables. Please see the link below for their precise formulation.\n Terms of Use and Services
Terms of Use and Services You attempt to use this app together with Parrot\'s AR.Drone 2.0. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s Terms of Use and Services for the drone and to Catrobat\'s Terms of Use and Services. Do not remind me again.
You attempt to use Pocket Code together with Parrot\'s Jumping Sumo. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s terms of use for the drone and to Catrobat\'s terms of use for Pocket Code.
About this app This app offers a programming environment and interpreter for the visual programming language Catrobat.\n\n The source code of this app is mainly licensed under the GNU AGPL v3 License. For further details on the license see the link below.\n Source Code License About Catrobat

Formula editor The formula editor allows you to create mathematical and logical formulas that you can use in your bricks.\n\nYou can advance this little intro by touching the \"Next\" button in the bottom right corner, and you can skip it by touching the \"SKIP\" button in the bottom left corner. Input field Here you can see your formula, and can also edit it. Keyboard Similar to a calculator, this is where you can create your formula. Compute To test your formula and display its current result, you can use \"Compute\". Object This is a collection of values that describe your current object. Some of these values are for example the x- and y-coordinates, or the current speed. Functions Like a calculator, the formula editor offers a multitude of mathematical functions.\nYou can find trigonometric functions such as \"sin\" and \"cos\", but also a random number generator or text and list functions. Logic Logic is used to compare values and combine logical formulas.\nTo compare values you can use logical operations such as \">\" (greater than) or \"=\" (equals).\nTo combine logical formulas you can use logical operations such as \"AND\", \"OR\" and \"NOT\". Device In \"Device\" you can find information that your smartphone or tablet records.\nFor example, the tilt of your device, or the loudness of your surroundings. Data Variables and lists that are used in your program can be found here.\nYou can simply insert these in your formula, or add new ones.

Warning! Deleting a variable that is still in use is dangerous! Are you sure? Yes, delete anyway! No.
Your program gets uploaded to the app’s sharing site where others can use and download it. You can also download your program as a standalone app. Show program
Got it Enable to show hints Show hints All bricks are sorted in categories. Choose the category you are looking for. To add a brick to your script, tap on the brick you want to use. Short tap on a brick opens the menu to move, copy, delete, or add a brick to the backpack. The help option will show you additional information. Drag and drop the brick with a long press. The script defines the behavior of your object. To add bricks to the script, tap on the "+" symbol. Here you can find the different appearances of your object. To add a new look, tap on the "+" symbol. Here you can add new sounds to your object. Keep in mind to use a brick from the sound category. Your program consists of different objects that can interact with each other. To add a new object, tap on the "+" symbol. To merge two programs, long press on one program to open the menu and tap on \'Merge with\'. Hit the back-button to pause your program. To show axes and the screen size of your device, tap "Axes on". A program can consist of different independent scenes. To add a new scene, tap on the "+" symbol. Change the listed settings as you wish or switch to predefined profiles to choose a god to help you with these settings. Choose a guide to help you with Create@School. Which one fits to you? Choose one of the predefined templates and modify it.
The app has crashed! Please help to improve our app by sending us anonymous crash reports! Always send Send +
Device Language

The grand prize is an invitation to the Google headquarters in California together with a parent, with tons of other goodies and giveaways from Google and Catrobat for participants! Check it out on http://catrob.at/gci

gravity jumper-x jumper-y falling score multiply animation number label timer Start Background title instruction control buttons button play button play button instruction button instruction Game instruction - add your own game instruction - add your instruction game instruction example game instruction template button back button back Platform game example initialize game jumping jumper music game start multiplies the score score gets multiplied every time the jumper is falling down moving background clouds 1 clouds 1 if the jumper changes its position the clouds are moving clouds 2 clouds 2 if the jumper changes its position the clouds are moving game elements jumper jumper1 jumper2 jumper3 jumper4 jumper5 jumper6 jumper7 WaterDrop Saves the position of the jumper permanently Defines the movement of the jumper (left right) and the screen borders. animation of the jumper defines the falling of the jumper game over bounce sets the jumping power of the jumper pickup fluorine chlorine bromine iodine astatine Pop picked-up places the pickup and moves it multiply up pickup to avoid oxygen kalium iron helium calcium places the pickup and moves it multiply down HUD elements HUD elements HUD Define timer display field display field platforms platform1 platform1 platform2 platform2 platform3 platform3 platform4 platform4 platform5 platform5 platform6 platform6 Platform game template task task game elements - add code and images pickup - add your images pickup template pickup to avoid - add your images template blue template yellow template red template orange template green HUD elements - add timer You can set a new value for the timer step 1: add a forever brick step 2: add an if then else brick. If the timer is greater than 0 change variable timer by -1 step 3: else broadcast message \'game over\' extra task - add level up level up display step 1: create a new variable level step 2: add a forever loop and an if-condition step 3: if the score reaches a certain amount like 200, 400, 600, 800 or 1000 show this object for 1 second step 4: change variable level by 1 and repeat End (last scene) end button play again button play again animation number title instruction start multiplies the score score gets multiplied every time the jumper is falling down Saves the position of the jumper permanently animation of the jumper defines the falling of the jumper sets the jumping power of the jumper step 3: else broadcast message \'game over\' step 1: create a new variable level step 2: add a forever loop and an if-condition step 3: if the score reaches a certain amount like 200, 400, 600, 800 or 1000 show this object for 1 second step 4: change variable level by 1 and repeat

if you let the rocket go its acceleration is calculated and variable touched becomes false if both rockets crossed the line you have to calculate the acceleration if rocket starts moving the shuttle starts moving too if rocket touches the finish line variables are set acceleration start shuttle acceleration rocket acceleration shuttle start shuttle end shuttle end rocket start rocket end without rocket answer force shuttle 1 force shuttle 2 Experiment 1 - simulation Background game elements task 1 finish line display field rockets rocket shuttle HUD elements label mass label force check answer Experiment 2 - hands on task 2 rockets - add you code ToDo: modify this object Experiment 3 - extra task task 3 finish line 2 rope button question button try again shuttle 2 game task 1 show elements finish line display field show result rocket-1 rocket-2 touched mass force the force is rising as long as you keep pressing the rocket if you let the rocket go the acceleration is calculated and variable touched becomes false after both rockets crossed the line you have to calculate the acceleration correct wrong shuttle-1 shuttle-2 if the rocket starts moving the shuttle starts moving too if the rocket touches the finish line variables are set label mass label force correct wrong task 2 Add your own rocket step 1: add a look and place your rocket step 2: set two local variables. One for the mass of the rocket and one for the force step 3: show both variables in the corresponding labels step 4: calculate the rocket\'s acceleration and set the variable \'acceleration rocket\' step 5: add a new brick to set the velocity of Y to the value of the variable \'acceleration rocket\' and multiply with - 1000 ToDo: add the collision detection between your rocket and the finish line in the When-brick task 3 end rope start simulation button question button try again the force is rising as long as you keep on pressing the rocket shuttle sky step 5: add a new brick to set the velocity of X to the variable acceleration and multiply with 1000 shuttle 1 and shuttle 2 have same acceleration
move detected Start Background title instruction title instruction start buttons button play game button play button instruction button instruction button setup button setup button back button back Setup game setup setup Simulation - control with buttons play show elements task 1 task 1 button next button next control buttons button forward controls_up controls_pressed_up button backward controls_down controls_pressed_down button left controls_left controls_pressed_left button right controls_right controls_pressed_right button stop controls_stop controls_pressed_stop button play play_sound play_sound_pressed Hands on - control by using inclination task 2 task 2 animation animation forward front back right left controller - add your code back controller - finished as example If inclination_y is greater than (>) 50 set motor B+C to -50%% (backward) speed. If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed. ahead controller ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 50%% speed. right controller ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 50 %%. left controller ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 50 %%. no inclination controller ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' and \'inclination_y\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the values. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). Combine both terms with AND ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors. ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 20 %%. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 20 %%. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors. ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_ultrasonic\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t remove the second part (AND move = TRUE). ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'EV3 Lego\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. The robot should turn to the right gorgeous 5 seconds. ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE. Extra task - create a maze ultrasonic sensor task 3 task 3 maze controller - add your code maze ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'infrated\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Keep the second part (AND move = true) ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'Lego EV3\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'Lego EV3\'. The robot should turn to the right fir 5 seconds. ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'EV3_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors. End (Last Scene) end button play again button play again

If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed. ahead controller ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed. right controller ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 20 %%. left controller ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the values. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). Combine both terms with AND ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors. Extra task - create a maze ultrasonic sensor task 3 task 3 maze controller - add your code maze ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_ultrasonic\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'NXT Lego\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'NXT Lego\'. The robot should turn to the right. ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE. ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors. End (Last Scene) end button play again button play again
x y points level lives max points Start Background title instruction instructions title game buttons button play game button play button instructions button instructions button back button back Race example level game gameOver task task1 Shows the task and start the game when tapping on it. startLevel game elements truck truck HUD bar hud If you reach the maximal number of points the next level starts Set the values for the variables game over display game over display button play again button play again elements to catch catch1 catch1 Sets the place for the objects to fall and sets the velocity of the objects The variable points is changed by 1 if the truck collects this object catch2 catch2 Sets the place for the objects to fall and sets the velocity of the objects The variable points is changed by 2 if the truck collects this object catch3 catch3 The variable points is changed by 3 if the truck collects this object elements to avoid avoid1 avoid1 explode Sets the random place for the objects to drive and lets them glide With every accident you lose one life. avoid2 avoid2 Sets the place for the objects to drive and lets them glide With every accident you lose one life.
